intro: Rajania bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
